Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the upper-body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is elaborated with bands of multiple grooves, covered with a self-slip and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394866) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394866)
